name: Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa

reviews.title: Vegas Without the Hustle & Bustle
reviews.text: Great resort with wonderful views -- either mountains or city lights. Easy access but away from the hustle, bustle and hassle of the Strip. Restaurants are varied and good to exceptional. Entertainment options range from gaming and top music acts (though a bit too youth oriented for my taste) to movies and bowling. The pool area is beautiful and easy to enjoy even if you don't go in the water, and the spa is top notch in both appearance and sdervices. Casino is well laid out and easy to get around -- and it's also much more attractively decorated than most, with the design elements mirroring the natural Red Rock surroundings. Finally, the rooms are beautifully appointed, spacious and exceedingly comfortable, with a great bath. Put in a microwave and a full refrigerator instead of the mini-bar and I could happily live in one of them forever! Go Red Rock.

reviews.title: exceeds expectations in every category
reviews.text: I have been visiting Red Rock hotel since it opened; it immediately became my favorite place to go; I live in Las Vegas so I have lots of options; the entire staff is always understanding and gracious, the multiple restaurants provide every type of cuisine, the gambling is great with many choices; it is the only place I take my out-of town visitors, the rooms are spacious and always clean; I especially enjoy the pool area which makes me feel like I am at an exclusive tropical resort with all its amenities; also, with its high ceilings, you don't have to look for a place to sit just because you are a non-smoker; and there is always a cocktail server around if you want some liquid refreshment; HAVE FUN!!!!!

reviews.title: Beautiful Facility and Service
reviews.text: Stayed during the week for an Easter trip with the kids. Very accommodating, facility well kept, peaceful, rooms quiet and roomy. Beds were blissfully comfortable. All request met quickly for extra pillows, etc. Used spa and it was very nice - service and facility. Have been here multiple times and would gladly go again and recommend highly.

reviews.title: Paradise - A Fabulous Experience at the Red Rock Resort
reviews.text: My teenage son and I traveled to Las Vegas for his high school spring break. I wanted him to experience Las Vegas but not the strip everynight so I chose the Red Rock Resort based on reviews on this website and a visit to their website. The resort is about 20 minutes from the strip so I rented a car so we could get around. I am pretty sure that the resort offers a shuttle but we never used it. Our room was immaculate and comfortable. Our beds felt like heaven! The bathroom was gorgeous and large. The bathroom had a TV in it which was great as my son often slept in and I could get ready and watch the Royal Wedding at the same time. Everyone at the resort was friendly and accommodating. The restaurants were bountiful. They offered an amazing array of cuisine and price points. My favorite place was The Cafe - great food and service and a beautiful atmosphere. The Red Rock bowling lanes were impressive and we had a great time bowling. The movie theatre was beautiful and clean. There was so many lounges to choose from around the pool I had trouble deciding where to sit! The water in the pool was too cold - I am not sure if it is ever heated - we are from the Northeast and unfortunately are used to pools being heated. Sat out in the sunshine nevertheless and enjoyed lunch outside. The concierge was extremely helpful. My son and I took Pink Jeep Tours to the Grand Canyon and to the Hoover Dam. Be sure to ask for a guide name "Chris" - he was a true gentleman and a wonderful guide. Went to the strip several nights - saw "O" and "Las Vegas, the Show!". We had a great time! Went into most of the hotels there - the Mirage, Bellagio, New York New York, Venetian etc. - all were noisy and extremely large - the influx of people was overwelming. Red Rock was pure paradise - a welcome retreat from the chaos of the strip. We loved our stay and hope to return one day.

reviews.title: 2nd visit to resort, excellent resort, took 1st timers and they loved it -we will all go back-
reviews.text: Our 2nd visit to Red Rock-took 1st timers to vegas with us and they are already planning to go back to vegas and stay at Red Rock--more laid back, excellent staff -big rooms, new facility-great food and service-locals located out west next to the mountains-shuttle to strip -if you miss shuttle back to resort about $50 taxi back to resort-not bad $ when split between 4 and conidering it costs $10 to $15 to get a taxi from one end of the strip to the other end. Check for entertainment -they get some great shows-

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice spa. Extensive pool area that has fountains and more than a dozen pools -- usually you can have your own. Bed, bedding the best. Two flat screen TVs in each room. Bathrooms are extensive, deep tub, beautiful shower, great sinks. Cleanest rooms anywhere. No matter your gambling tastes, the casino has it. Eats are the best: a bagel deli, fine Italian restaurant, gourmet burgers, buffet, several fast food places, two Starbucks, steak house, several other specialty restaurants and an excellent Cafe if nothing else suits. Extensive deluxe movie theatres and bowling alleys. Now, here is the frosting on top: all appointments are fabulous and will take your breath away, even the hallways to rooms where doors are set back to reduce noise to rooms. And their service is excellent even when someone like me stumbles in in blue jeans. I've been to the Broadmor in Colorado Springs and The Del Coronado in San Diego and this place provides so much more. Can't say enough about them.. We do not leave the site for anything when in Vegas.
reviews.title: Hotel-Casino Has It All

reviews.text: Very Enjoyable Place . Definitely Coming Back , Husband & Family Enjoyed Their Time . Great Service , A Stay To Remember !
reviews.title: Best Place Ever !

reviews.text: My stay at RedRock was for business and I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was. I usually stay on the strip, but chose the RedRock as it was close to my meetings. My room was beautiful, the restaurants were fantastic, and the overall hotel was simply awesome. Terra Rosa was especially wonderful - the food was FANTASTIC!!
reviews.title: RedRock is a wonderful hotel - but Room Service is too expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One issue I encountered was the Room Service. Since I was travelling alone my husband decided to send a fruit and cheese tray to my room as a treat after a long day of flights. He was quoted about $58 for a fruit and cheese tray and 4 bottles of Diet Coke. He was actually charged $88.00 for the order. $88 for fruit, cheese, crackers, and a few bottles of Diet Coke is very high. It was expecially high considering he was quoted $58. He did call regarding the charge and was told that the $58 was quoted was before taxes, delivery fees, etc.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: If I do stay at the Red Rock again, I will certainly not be ordering room service
reviews.title: Awesome Place

reviews.text: If you are looking for a beautiful place to stay in while in Las Vegas, this is it! Mind you, it is OFF the strip. So if you like the fast, busy, crowded and noisyness of the strip then you should not stay here. The resort DOES have a shuttle that runs to the strip. It stops coming back to the hotel at 9PM. Not very late. A cab back will cost you around $60 (incl tip). The weekends are much busier, the clubs are in high gear and there's lots going on with the bowling alley, movies, bingo, and gambling.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Personally, I LOVED it here!!! The pool area was gorgeous with a great sound system. Tip: Drinks were way too expensive at the pool, so play a slot and get a freebie.
reviews.title: Great value, nice property, huge rooms

reviews.text: The casino was just the right size. Excellent restaurants. T-bones is upscale and pricey, but worth it. The breakfast buffet was delicious. I usually don't go for buffets as they tend to have substandard food, but this one was excellent.
reviews.title: I've stayed here 14 or 15 times... it's worth the trip off the strip

reviews.text: Didn't get chance to check out the spa since we chose to go kayaking, atv'ing and attending the let's make a deal show.
reviews.title: Customer beware

reviews.text: The rooms are large, clean and provide either a view of the strip or canyon. We took the canyon and it was beautiful.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel lacking in customer service & bias (for a lack of better words)

reviews.text: Was here for a conference. Big, nice rooms, excellent service, cool decor. Pretty quiet casino. I am told that locals come here and like it b/c not as many tourists. Gym closes at 8:00 PM (boooo). I highly recommend this place for conferences. We never needed to leave the hotel. Constant access to high quality food. Attentive staff. Watch out for the 48 hour cancellation. We gave 24 hrs b/c weren't staying the 3rd night, and they hassled us, but eventually decided not to charge us for it.
reviews.title: 19 miles from strip, but very high quality hotel

reviews.text: This new hotel/casino/resort is really nice and has updated rooms. The package I booked gave us a $50 food/beverage credit and $20 gas cards. Although there is a resort fee, the pool/ spa/ gym were well worth it. Went to the club during the nightime and caught a nice little performance.
reviews.title: Red Rock is awesome

reviews.text: I stayed at the Red Rock for three days for a wedding at their golf course, less than 2 miles away. It was with extended family from all parts of the country and the world. I have been to vegas over 50-times since a lot of my family lives in las vegas. I usually fly out to vegas about two to three times a year. A little background about me, I am a business college student who has extensive world-travel experience. I like luxury and usually 4-5 star hotels when I travel but I know when I get a good value and when it is overprice. I have stayed from a range of hostels in Europe to the Shangra-la in Asia. So, overall I prefer 4 stars and higher but I am not ignorant of cost.
reviews.title: Expert Las Vegas Traveller- a good hotel in a niche market

reviews.text: I payed about 135 a night for the hotel room, not including the resort fee. This included two free buffets and two free movie tickets. This is more than the hotels on the strip. This is about as much as a Paris stay or a good deal at the Bellagio. It is on the expensive side but there is no other hotel even near the Red Rock. It is the only hotel really in the area. This is NOT a hotel to stay at if you want to go to the strip. It really serves locals and those who are going to Red Rock Canyon. It is about 30 mins to the strip so it is far. Plus, the traffic and street lights suck. If you stay at Red Rock, do not plan on going to the strip much.
reviews.title: Relaxing location with modern and spacious rooms

reviews.text: Casino- They play the "21" movie sound track everywhere! The techno music tries to make it feel hip like the entire place is a Starbucks or a club. The hotel elevators BLARE the music. When the doors open on your hotel floor, the music fills the entire hallway. It is not too loud like at a club but you have to raise your voice to talk.The decor is great and modern. It has a very new feel. The entire design is basically minimalism with a splash of sixties colors. Red, orange, brown, and green are the main colors they play with in the entire resort. The chandeliers are amazing and well placed. Relating to the gaming, the actual slots do not pay out much (this is coming from my family who lives near the hotel). I mainly played the tables. I tripled my bet and won a 100 dollars at blackjack. Irena is great. She is from Greece and she was amazing. She told people when to double down.
reviews.title: great off strip option

reviews.text: Red Rock offers all the amenities of the major Vegas strip hotels without the hoards of people that you find on the strip. The hotel offers excellent restaurants, from the Feast Buffet for breakfast to super high quality steak, seafood and Italian restaurants for dinner. Perhaps the best quality of the hotel is, they cater to the locals that live in the Summerlin area. This is one of the reasons you are not just a number and makes you want to come back. When you stay at Red Rock make sure you take in the surrounding countryside,it is extremely beautiful and just a short ride from the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent alternative in relation to the hetic chaotic strip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have been staying at Red Rock since they opened several years ago. We absolutely love it! The fresh, sleek design of both the hotel and casino is a vision. The rooms are huge and extremely well-appointed, the casino is clean and fresh and there is a large variety of restaurants....plus some great fast food places. Because it is off the strip, we especially appreciate that we are not subjected to the rowdy night time crowds that frequent the strip casinos. I'm sorry that I don't have photos, but if you go to redrocklasvegas.com you will see the hotel and casino.
reviews.title: LOVE Red Rock

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would highly recommend Red Rock to everyone.
reviews.title: Outstanding Resort!

reviews.text: My husband and I travel to Las Vegas 3 times a year and we always stay at Red Rock Hotel.
reviews.title: I come back to the Red Rock year after year.....love everything about it!

reviews.text: Our recent stay in April was as fabulous as ever and the staff continues to be some of the best in the industry.
reviews.title: Chillaxing with wife and baby.

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived until the day we departed, the Red Rock Hotel was beyond our expectations. The entire staff was courteous and uber-friendly. The hotel grounds were as beautiful as the backdrops of the surrounding mountains. The room was top notch! It was ultra modern from the flat screen t.v. to the BOSE sound system. The only drawback, was our room was located on the opposite end of the elevator, which entailed a slightly long hike. Request a room not too far from the elevator.
reviews.title: Red Rock Hotel does not dissappoint!
Red Rock Casino/Hotel
reviews.text: We just returned from a 4 day stay at a delightful refuge in the desert, Red Rock Casino & Hotel. It was truly wonderful and relaxing experience and only 20 minutes from the hustle & bustle of "Sin City". Whenever we return to Las Vegas, we will most certainly stay here as it is much more beautiful and tranquil than the Strip area. We made reservations each night for dinner at one of the Strip hotel restaurants and saw Cher perform at Ceasar's (great show!); but each night we were happy to drive back to our room at Red Rock Hotel and sleep until the sunrise was illuminating the red mountaintops outside our floor to ceiling windows each morning. The pool area was quite nice but the polite, attentive staff was the most outstanding feature of this resort. The only negative we experienced was the extremely long walk from the elevators to our room ( about 75 yards!). If you have knee, foot or ankle problems..... this is a difficult trek and they were unable to move us until the next day due their high occupancy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms at the Red Rock are all in alcoves off the hall. While this may seem like it would provide a quiet and relaxing atmosphere, in reality it creates a wind tunnel that makes the room shake any time a door is closed within 10 rooms of yours. We have stayed in many resorts and this hotel is a 4 star at best.
reviews.title: Noisy and claustrophic "resort"

reviews.text: I visited the Red Rock Casino, Resort and Spa in Las Vegas for an Event Planners Convention in August of 2009.
reviews.title: Incredible Off-Strip Hotel that will DEFINITELY see my business again!

reviews.text: The facility offers complimentary shuttle service to and from the Las Vegas airport as well as the Las Vegas strip. This service is a fantasic asset since the hotel is located quite a distance from the Las Vegas strip and typical taxi service costs approximately $50 each way.
reviews.title: Generic Behemoth Las Vegas Hotel/Casino

reviews.text: If you want and affordable but extremely classy resort, Red Rock is for you. This property has everything you would need for a three or four day stay and never leave the property. Complete selection or restaurant choices from fast food to one of the best steakhouses in Vegas. Modern and classy rooms, awesome pool area and great mountain views. I've stayed there numerous times with no complaints. Service and hospitality and number one. Only drawback is distance from strip but there are shuttles or just rent a car and visit Mt. Charleston, another little Vegas secret.
reviews.title: Affordable Class

reviews.text: The staff of this resort should be commended for their excellence of service and can do attitude. The facility has every thing you could ask for under one roof. From a poolside bar and grill with attentive great looking servers, to a five star steakhouse with mouth watering entrees. The deep fried Oreos for dessert were beyond delicious. The table games were staffed with pleasant dealers and helpful pit bosses that took the time to interact with the patrons. Although I did not hit the clubs,my friends said that it was a rocking scene and they stayed and closed the place. The rooms were some of the finest I have seen in Vegas and at half the price! The fact that there is a mall across the street is a huge bonus for those of us that always forget to pack something.I travel to Vegas several times a year and you can bet I will be returning to the Red Rock on my next trip. Thanks for a wonderful long weekend.
reviews.title: Pampered relaxation at it's best

reviews.text: Relaxing, posh, sensational hotel. It is located away from the strip, so it is a much more calm atmosphere. Plenty of pool room with awesome wait staff. As a single mom it is difficult to find an affordable, yet luxurious travel destination. Everything I needed to entertain and service my children & I was under one roof: marble deep soaking tub, posh room decor, very friendly and helpful staff, bowling, pool, IMAX 16 cinema, childcare, ATM,arcade, restaurants & Starbucks. The kids were entertained & all of us felt like royalty in our white robes, upgraded room to a suite & mountain view. The whole atmosphere at Red Rock is dialed in for spoiling their guests & making every effort to make everyone feel special. I've already booked an amazing trip in a few months....for the same it would cost me to go to the movies down the street with my family.
reviews.title: Red Rock was not a mirage...it was a rejuviating oasis for my family, mind & soul

reviews.text: This is one of the most beautifully furnished hotels in Las Vegas. The staff were awesome!
reviews.title: We stayed at the Red Rock after a week in Hawaii and it topped our honeymoon off fantasticaly!

reviews.text: excellent from the start to the finish service-location and most of all value red rock is the best of the best thanks and will be back
reviews.title: red rock (rocks)
Hilary loves the Red Rock
reviews.text: We loved it - great pool - great food - bowling - movies - something for everyone!

We stayed from Wednesday to Saturday...had plenty of space to ourselves mid week from pool to casino to restaurants. Spa is beautiful. There is a quiet retreat using the spa pool and private spots to read and enjoy the peace & quiet. By the weekend, it was much busier as two concerts were scheduled making for some intersting people watching!
reviews.title: everything you can ask for in one place

reviews.text: Drinks at pool are very expensive. Food at hotel buffet was good value. Ask about two for one coupons at the casino courtesy area and check the daily paper they deliver to your room for discounts, as well. Don't take anything out of the fridge in room...if you don't want it within 45 seconds, you'll be charged. No coffee pots in room which was a bummer...never stayed at a hotel that didn't have one. Rooms very spacious and bathrooms great. Staff was very nice and accomodating.
reviews.title: Exceptional in every way
Las Vegas stay at Red Rock Hotel & Casino
reviews.text: The service at the Red Rock was outstanding.
The staff was accomodating making our convention completly successful and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Great Spa, Great Room, Poor Pool Service

aka: Red Rock Casino Resort And Spa
description: Red Rock's serene surroundings, distinctive décor and impeccable standard of service ensure that your Las Vegas hotel stay is flawless and fabulous. Exquisite rooms and Las Vegas hotel suites offer an unmatched combination of comfort, extravagance and value while inspiring mountain vistas will transfix you during your vacation, travel or getaway. Whether relaxing in our expansive pool backyard, playing your hand at poker or savoring a first-class meal, Red Rock Resort & Spa has a flavor for all your tastes and desires during your Las Vegas vacation.
